IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TREATMENT OF THE DISEASE OF CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVIDING A HEALING ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH CHEMICALLY DEPENDENT INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES DISCOVER AN ENHANCED QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH LONG-TERM RECOVERY FROM ADDICTIONS.
IRS990.Desc: TREATMENT OF CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY THROUGH INPATIENT AND RESIDENTIAL SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SERENITY LANE HEALTH SERVICES, SERENITY LANE, AND SERENITY LANE HEALTH SERVICES FOUNDATION ARE NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES. SERENITY LANE HEALTH SERVICES, SERENITY LANE, AND SERENITY LANE HEALTH SERVICES FOUNDATION HAVE ALSO BEEN CLASSIFIED AS ENTITIES THAT ARE NOT PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS WITHIN THE MEANING OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION HAS BEEN MADE FOR INCOME TAXES IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS PURSUANT TO ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION GENERALLY EVALUATES ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS CONSISTENT WITH THE ACCOUNTING AND DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS OF ASC 450, CONTINGENCIES. THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS IN CONNECTION WITH THESE CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: PART V, SECTION B, LINE 5: THE HOSPITAL CONSULTED WITH RESPECTED COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND INCLUDED THEIR COMMENTARY IN THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT. THE HOSPITAL CONSULTED WITH CANDACE LANGHOUSE, HUMAN RESOURCES AT SACRED HEART MEDICAL CENTER; EDWIN SCHNEIDER, RPH, PROFESSIONAL RECOVERY NETWORK PRESIDENT, AND CHRISTOPER J. HAMILTON, PHD, MPA, MONITORING PROGRAMS, PROGRAM DIRECTOR, AT RELIANT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.
PART V, SECTION B, LINE 11: PRIORITIZATION OF HEALTH NEEDS AND SERVICES IN THE COMMUNITY.
PART V, SECTION B, LINE 16J: THE FAP, FAP APPLICATION, AND FAP PLAIN LANGUAGE SUMMARY ARE AVAILABLE AT HTTPS://SERENITYLANE.ORG/ADMISSIONS/COSTS-AND-INSURANCE-INFO/FINANCIAL-ASSISTANCE-POLICY/

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE H, PART V, LINE 13, THE ORGANIZATION ALSO USES INSURANCE STATUS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR FREE OR DISCOUNTED CARE.

CHARITY CARE COST IS ESTIMATED BASED UPON A PRO-RATA PERCENTAGE OF TOTAL PATIENT SERVICE COSTS TO TOTAL PATIENT SERVICE REVENUES.COMMUNITY SERVICES AND EDUCATION ARE TRACKED BY EVENT OR ACTIVITY WITH DIRECT COST BEING ACCUMULATED.
ESTIMATED AT GROSS REVENUES PRIOR TO DISCOUNTS AND PAYMENTS.
ESTIMATED AT 1-2% OF GROSS REVENUES, LESS PRIOR ACCOUNTS WRITTEN-OFF BUT COLLECTED IN THE CURRENT PERIOD.

IF PATIENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND PROVIDES PROPER DOCUMENTATION, THEN BALANCES ARE WRITTEN-OFF TO CHARITY CARE (NOT BAD-DEBT EXPENSE) WHICH IS NETTED WITH GROSS REVENUES. NO DETERMINATION OF THOSE WHO MAY QUALIFY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS MADE UNLESS PROPER INFORMATION IS SUPPLIED AND ASSISTANCE IS REQUESTED.

ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE CARRIED AT THEIR ESTIMATED COLLECTIBLE AMOUNTS. IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS, THE ORGANIZATION EXTENDS UNSECURED CREDIT TO THIRD PARTY PAYORS AND PRIVATE PARTIES. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FOR AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS AND AN ALLOWANCE FOR CONTRACTUAL ADJUSTMENTS THAT IS BASED UPON REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION, EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS, AND CONTRACT RATES WITH THIRD PARTY PAYORS. ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE WITH THIRD PARTY PAYORS ARE GENERALLY DUE BASED UPON SUBMISSION OF THE CLAIM. THE MAJORITY OF RECEIVABLES FROM PRIVATE PARTIES ARE FINANCED OVER 18-36 MONTHS AS DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF DISCHARGE. NO NONCURRENT PORTION IS SEGREGATED AS ESTIMATION IS DIFFICULT AND NOT RELIABLE. IF THE NONCURRENT PORTION COULD BE REASONABLY ESTIMATED, SUCH CLASSIFICATION MAY HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE CURRENT PORTION OF ASSETS; HOWEVER, IT WOULD NOT CHANGE THE OVERALL FINANCIAL POSITION OF THE ORGANIZATION. FINANCE CHARGES ARE CALCULATED AT 18% PER ANNUM AND SECURITY ARRANGEMENTS, IF ANY, VARY WITH THE FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE PRIVATE PARTIES. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES NONACCRUAL OF INTEREST ON DELINQUENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ON AN ACCOUNT-BY-ACCOUNT BASIS BASED UPON HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE PRIVATE PARTY. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES AND EVALUATES PAST DUE BALANCES ON AN ACCOUNT-BY-ACCOUNT BASIS, AND IF AMOUNTS BECOME UNCOLLECTIBLE, THEY WILL BE WRITTEN-OFF WHEN THE DETERMINATION IS MADE.THERE WAS NO CHANGE IN THE METHODOLOGY USED BY THE ORGANIZATION TO ESTIMATE THE ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS AND THE ALLOWANCE FOR CONTRACTUAL ADJUSTMENTS IN THE CURRENT YEAR.
IF THE PATIENT REQUESTS CONSIDERATION AND PROVIDES THE REQUESTED AND APPROPRIATE SUPPORT, FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED.

IN ADDITION TO THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT SERENITY LANE DOES THE FOLLOWING TO ADDRESS THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY:1. THE BOARD IS MADE UP OF HIGHLY RESPECTED MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY REPRESENTING DIFFERENT ASPECTS, SUCH AS DOCTORS, HUMAN RESOURCE DIRECTORS, PRIESTS, ETC...2. SERENITY LANE STAYS IN CONTACT WITH NUMEROUS REPRESENTATIVES OF THE COMMUNITY, SUCH AS POLICE OFFICERS AND ELECTED REPRESENTATIVES. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO MAINTAINS CONTACT WITH OTHER PROFESSIONALS SERVICING THE ALCOHOL AND DRUG ABUSE ARENA INCLUDING AN ANNUAL AWARDS BANQUET SPONSORED AND ORGANIZED BY SERENITY LANE THAT RECOGNIZES OTHERS IN THE COMMUNITY THAT HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT IN THIS ARENA.3. SERENITY LANE HAS AN INTERNAL QUALITY ASSURANCE LICENSED STAFF TO PERFORM ROUTINE INSPECTIONS OF OTHER SIMILAR FACILITIES TO ENSURE THE ORGANIZATION IS UP TO DATE WITH THE LATEST PROCESSES AND TECHNOLOGY.4. SERENITY LANE PERFORMS ANNUAL PATIENT SURVEYS.5. SERENITY LANE ACCUMULATES PATIENT DATA BY GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION WHICH HELPS ALIGN SERVICES WITH THE CURRENT NEED.
PATIENTS WITHOUT ADEQUATE RESOURCES ARE DIRECTED TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO APPLY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.
NEARLY ALL COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF OREGON AND VANCOUVER, WA. CONSTITUENTS SERVED ARE THE WORKING MEN AND WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES.

PROVIDING COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND RESOURCES REGARDING THE DISEASE OF CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY. THIS IS DONE THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN CONFERENCES, EDUCATING EMPLOYERS, NEWS ARTICLES AND OTHER COMMUNITY OUTREACH PRACTICES.

PURSUANT TO REV. PROC. 2015-21, SERENITY LANE (THE HOSPITAL) IS DISCLOSING THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION FOR FAILURES TO COMPLY WITH REGARD TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(R). TIMING OF DISCOVERY AND CORRECTION OF DEFICIENCIES: THE FOLLOWING FOUR ERRORS OR OMISSIONS WITH RESPECT TO SECTION 501(R) AND THE RELATED REGULATIONS WERE DISCOVERED AS A RESULT OF AN EXAMINATION WITH THE IRS FOR THE TAX YEAR ENDED MARCH 31, 2015. THE HOSPITAL RECEIVED INFORMATION DOCUMENT REQUESTS IN APRIL OF 2017 WITH RESPECT TO THE FORM 990 FILED FOR THE TAX YEAR ENDED MARCH 31, 2015. AT THE CLOSE OF THE EXAM ON DECEMBER 29, 2017 THE TAX RETURN WAS ACCEPTED AS FILED. CORRECTIONS WERE MADE BY FEBRUARY 2018 TO ADDRESS THE DEFICIENCIES NOTED.A) FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY (FAP)(1) DESCRIPTION OF FAILURE: THE HOSPITAL'S FAP DID NOT CONTAIN ADEQUATE PROVISIONS PURSUANT TO REGULATION 1.501(R)-4(B)(2) REGARDING: A) THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, B) THE METHOD AND FORMULA USED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT GENERALLY BILLED (AGB) FOR FAP ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS FOR EMERGENCY OR OTHER MEDICALLY NECESSARY CARE, AND C) THE AGB CHARGE LIMITATION FOR FAP ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS FOR EMERGENCY OR OTHER MEDICALLY NECESSARY CARE. THIS FAILURE OCCURRED DUE TO THE ORGANIZATIONS LACK OF CLARITY, UNDERSTANDING, AND APPLICABILITY OF THE REGULATIONS TO THE ORGANIZATION.(2) DESCRIPTION OF CORRECTION: THE FAP WAS REVISED TO INCLUDE THE APPLICABLE PROVISIONS EFFECTIVE JANUARY 29, 2018. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE AFFECTED BY THE DEFICIENCIES. THE FAP WAS REVISED AND IMPLEMENTED ON A PROSPECTIVE BASIS.(3) ESTABLISHMENT OR REVISION OF PRACTICES OR PROCEDURES: ALL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 501(R) AND THE RELATED REGULATIONS ARE NOW BEING MET, AND COMPLIANCE WILL BE MONITORED ON AN ONGOING BASIS AND WHENEVER CHANGES TO DOCUMENTS OCCUR.B) EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE POLICY(1) DESCRIPTION OF FAILURE: THE HOSPITAL DID NOT HAVE A WRITTEN EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE POLICY THAT MET THE REQUIREMENTS OF REGULATION 1.501(R)-4(C). THIS FAILURE OCCURRED DUE TO THE ORGANIZATIONS LACK OF CLARITY, UNDERSTANDING, AND APPLICABILITY OF THE REGULATIONS TO THE ORGANIZATION.(2) DESCRIPTION OF CORRECTION: THE EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE POLICY WAS CREATED EFFECTIVE JANUARY 29, 2018. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE AFFECTED BY THE DEFICIENCIES. THE EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE POLICY WAS IMPLEMENTED ON A PROSPECTIVE BASIS.(3) ESTABLISHMENT OR REVISION OF PRACTICES OR PROCEDURES: ALL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 501(R) AND THE RELATED REGULATIONS ARE NOW BEING MET, AND COMPLIANCE WILL BE MONITORED ON AN ONGOING BASIS AND WHENEVER CHANGES TO DOCUMENTS OCCUR.C) WIDELY PUBLICIZING FAP DOCUMENTS(1) DESCRIPTION OF FAILURE: THE FAP OR CHARITY CARE POLICY, APPLICATION FORM, PLAIN LANGUAGE SUMMARY AND WRITE-OFF OF BAD DEBT POLICY WERE NOT AVAILABLE FOR FREE DOWNLOAD ON THE HOSPITAL'S WEBSITE. THIS FAILURE OCCURRED DUE TO THE ORGANIZATIONS LACK OF CLARITY, UNDERSTANDING, AND APPLICABILITY OF THE REGULATIONS TO THE ORGANIZATION.(2) DESCRIPTION OF CORRECTION: ALL APPLICABLE DOCUMENTS WERE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE HOSPITAL'S WEBSITE EFFECTIVE FEBRUARY 2018. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE AFFECTED BY THE DEFICIENCIES. (3) ESTABLISHMENT OR REVISION OF PRACTICES OR PROCEDURES: ALL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 501(R) AND THE RELATED REGULATIONS ARE NOW BEING MET, AND COMPLIANCE WILL BE MONITORED ON AN ONGOING BASIS AND WHENEVER CHANGES TO DOCUMENTS OCCUR.D) WRITE-OFF OF BAD DEBT POLICY(1) DESCRIPTION OF FAILURE: THE WRITE-OFF OF BAD DEBT POLICY DID NOT INCLUDE ADEQUATE PROCESS AND TIME FRAME REQUIREMENTS PURSUANT TO REGULATION 1.501(R)-4(B)(4)(I)(B). THIS FAILURE OCCURRED DUE TO THE ORGANIZATIONS LACK OF CLARITY, UNDERSTANDING, AND APPLICABILITY OF THE REGULATIONS TO THE ORGANIZATION.(2) DESCRIPTION OF CORRECTION: THE WRITE-OFF OF BAD DEBT POLICY WAS REVISED TO INCLUDE THE APPLICABLE PROVISIONS EFFECTIVE JANUARY 29, 2018. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE AFFECTED BY THE DEFICIENCIES. THE WRITE-OFF OF BAD DEBT POLICY WAS REVISED AND IMPLEMENTED ON A PROSPECTIVE BASIS.(3) ESTABLISHMENT OR REVISION OF PRACTICES OR PROCEDURES: ALL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 501(R) AND THE RELATED REGULATIONS ARE NOW BEING MET, AND COMPLIANCE WILL BE MONITORED ON AN ONGOING BASIS AND WHENEVER CHANGES TO DOCUMENTS OCCUR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT/CEO, VP OF FINANCE/ADMINISTRATION AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES A STATEMENT FILLED OUT AND SIGNED PERIODICALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRESIDENT/CEO COMPENSATION IS SET BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS USING DATA FROM COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. VICE PRESIDENT COMPENSATION IS SET BY THE PRESIDENT/CEO USING USING DATA FROM COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. COMPENSATION WAS LAST DETERMINED IN 2016.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
